overview.summary: Due to a specified dipole, the potential on the outer sphere of a four layer spherical volume conductor is computed.

description.p: The potentials on the outer sphere are calculated analytically at the electrode positions. The spherical volume consists of four layers (skalp, skull, cerebrospinal fluid, brain), where every layer can have different radial and tangential conductivities. The dipole has to be in the innermost sphere.

port.name: Electrodes
port.description: The port takes a handle of the electrode positions, where the potential has to be computed.

port.name: Dipole Sources
port.description: The port takes a handle to the matrix that is 1-by-6 in size, containing parameters of 1 dipole. The first three columns are dipole position, the other three are dipole moments. If the dipole lies outside the innermost sphere, the log window creates a warning message.

port.name: Radii
port.description: The port takes a matrix containing the radii for scalp, skull, cerebrospinal fluid and the brain.

port.name: AnisoConductivities
port.description: The port takes a matrix containing radial and tangential conductivities of all 4 layers.

port.name: ElectrodePotentials
port.description: The initial field is populated with potential values.
